name: Matcher

methods.name: end
methods.description: Returns the position after the last matched character.

methods.name: end
methods.description: Returns the position after the last character of the subsequence captured by the group index during the previous match operation. If the match was successful but the group itself did not match anything, this method returns -1.

methods.name: find
methods.description: Attempts to find the next subsequence of the input sequence that matches the pattern. This method returns true if a subsequence of the input sequence matches this Matcher object's pattern.

methods.name: find
methods.description: Resets the Matcher object and then tries to find the next subsequence of the input sequence that matches the pattern. This method returns true if a subsequence of the input sequence matches this Matcher object's pattern.

methods.name: group
methods.description: Returns the input subsequence returned by the previous match.

methods.name: group
methods.description: Returns the input subsequence captured by the specified group index during the previous match operation. If the match was successful but the specified group failed to match any part of the input sequence, null is returned.

methods.name: groupCount
methods.description: Returns the number of capturing groups in this Matching object's pattern. Group zero denotes the entire pattern and is not included in this count.

methods.name: hasAnchoringBounds
methods.description: Returns true if the Matcher object has anchoring bounds, false otherwise. By default, a Matcher object uses anchoring bounds regions.

methods.name: hasTransparentBounds
methods.description: Returns true if the Matcher object has transparent bounds, false if it uses opaque bounds. By default, a Matcher object uses opaque region boundaries.

methods.name: hitEnd
methods.description: Returns true if the end of input was found by the search engine in the last match operation performed by this Matcher object. When this method returns true, it is possible that more input would have changed the result of the last search.

methods.name: lookingAt
methods.description: Attempts to match the input sequence, starting at the beginning of the region, against the pattern.

methods.name: matches
methods.description: Attempts to match the entire region against the pattern.

methods.name: pattern
methods.description: Returns the Pattern object from which this Matcher object was created.

methods.name: quoteReplacement
methods.description: Returns a literal replacement string for the specified string inputString. The characters in the returned string match the sequence of characters in inputString.

methods.name: region
methods.signature: public Matcher object region(Integer start, Integer end)
methods.description: Sets the limits of this Matcher object's region. The region is the part of the input sequence that is searched to find a match.

methods.name: regionEnd
methods.description: Returns the end index (exclusive) of this Matcher object's region.

methods.name: regionStart
methods.description: Returns the start index (inclusive) of this Matcher object's region.

methods.name: replaceAll
methods.description: Replaces every subsequence of the input sequence that matches the pattern with the replacement string.

methods.name: replaceFirst
methods.description: Replaces the first subsequence of the input sequence that matches the pattern with the replacement string.

methods.name: requireEnd
methods.description: Returns true if more input could change a positive match into a negative one.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets this Matcher object. Resetting a Matcher object discards all of its explicit state information.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets this Matcher object with the new input sequence. Resetting a Matcher object discards all of its explicit state information.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Returns the start index of the first character of the previous match.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Returns the start index of the subsequence captured by the group specified by the group index during the previous match operation. Captured groups are indexed from left to right, starting at one. Group zero denotes the entire pattern, so the expression m.start(0) is equivalent to m.start().

methods.name: useAnchoringBounds
methods.description: Sets the anchoring bounds of the region for the Matcher object. By default, a Matcher object uses anchoring bounds regions.

params.name: anchoringBounds
params.description: If you specify true, the Matcher object uses anchoring bounds. If you specify false, non-anchoring bounds are used.

methods.name: usePattern
methods.description: Changes the Pattern object that the Matcher object uses to find matches. This method causes the Matcher object to lose information about the groups of the last match that occurred. The Matcher object's position in the input is maintained.

methods.name: useTransparentBounds
methods.description: Sets the transparency bounds for this Matcher object. By default, a Matcher object uses anchoring bounds regions.

params.name: transparentBounds
params.description: If you specify true, the Matcher object uses transparent bounds. If you specify false, opaque bounds are used.

description: Matchers use Patterns to perform match operations on a character string.
